001// Copyright (c) Choreo contributors
002
003package choreo.auto;
004
005import static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Alert.AlertType.kWarning;
006
007import choreo.auto.AutoFactory.AllianceContext;
008import choreo.trajectory.Trajectory;
009import choreo.trajectory.TrajectorySample;
010import choreo.util.ChoreoAlert;
011import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.DriverStation;
012import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event.EventLoop;
013import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command;
014import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandScheduler;
015import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Commands;
016import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button.Trigger;
017import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
018
019/**
020 * An object that represents an autonomous routine.
021 *
022 * <p>This object is used to handle autonomous trigger logic and schedule commands for a single
023 * autonomous routine. This object should **not** be shared across multiple autonomous routines.
024 *
025 * @see AutoFactory#newRoutine Creating a routine from a AutoFactory
026 */
027public class AutoRoutine {
028  /**
029   * The factory that created this loop. This is used to create commands that are associated with
030   * this loop.
031   */
032  private final AutoFactory factory;
033
034  /** The underlying {@link EventLoop} that triggers are bound to and polled */
035  private final EventLoop loop = new EventLoop();
036
037  /** The name of the auto routine this loop is associated with */
038  private final String name;
039
040  /** The alliance helper that is used to determine flipping logic */
041  private final AllianceContext allianceCtx;
042
043  /** A boolean utilized in {@link #active()} to resolve trueness */
044  private boolean isActive = false;
045
046  /** A boolean that is true when the loop is killed */
047  boolean isKilled = false;
048
049  /** The amount of times the routine has been polled */
050  private int pollCount = 0;
051
052  /**
053   * Creates a new loop with a specific name and a custom alliance supplier.
054   *
055   * @param factory The factory that created this loop
056   * @param name The name of the loop
057   * @param allianceHelper The alliance helper that is used to determine flipping logic
058   * @see AutoFactory#newRoutine Creating a loop from a AutoFactory
059   */
060  AutoRoutine(AutoFactory factory, String name, AllianceContext allianceHelper) {
061    this.factory = factory;
062    this.name = name;
063    this.allianceCtx = allianceHelper;
064  }
065
066  /**
067   * Returns a {@link Trigger} that is true while this autonomous routine is being polled.
068   *
069   * <p>Using a {@link Trigger#onFalse(Command)} will do nothing as when this is false the routine
070   * is not being polled anymore.
071   *
072   * @return A {@link Trigger} that is true while this autonomous routine is being polled.
073   */
074  public Trigger active() {
075    return new Trigger(loop, () -> isActive && DriverStation.isAutonomousEnabled());
076  }
077
078  /** Polls the routine. Should be called in the autonomous periodic method. */
079  public void poll() {
080    if (!DriverStation.isAutonomousEnabled() || !allianceCtx.allianceKnownOrIgnored() || isKilled) {
081      isActive = false;
082      return;
083    }
084    pollCount++;
085    loop.poll();
086    isActive = true;
087  }
088
089  /**
090   * Gets the event loop that this routine is using.
091   *
092   * @return The event loop that this routine is using.
093   */
094  public EventLoop loop() {
095    return loop;
096  }
097
098  /**
099   * Creates a {@link Trigger} that is bound to the routine's {@link EventLoop}.
100   *
101   * @param condition The condition represented by the trigger.
102   * @return A {@link Trigger} that mirrors the state of the provided {@code condition}
103   */
104  public Trigger observe(BooleanSupplier condition) {
105    return new Trigger(loop, condition);
106  }
107
108  /**
109   * Gets the poll count of the routine.
110   *
111   * @return The poll count of the routine.
112   */
113  int pollCount() {
114    return pollCount;
115  }
116
117  /**
118   * Resets the routine. This can either be called on auto init or auto end to reset the routine
119   * incase you run it again. If this is called on a routine that doesn't need to be reset it will
120   * do nothing.
121   */
122  public void reset() {
123    pollCount = 0;
124    isActive = false;
125  }
126
127  /** Kills the loop and prevents it from running again. */
128  public void kill() {
129    CommandScheduler.getInstance().cancelAll();
130    if (isKilled) {
131      return;
132    }
133    reset();
134    ChoreoAlert.alert("Killed an auto loop", kWarning).set(true);
135    isKilled = true;
136  }
137
138  /**
139   * Creates a new {@link AutoTrajectory} to be used in an auto routine.
140   *
141   * @param trajectoryName The name of the trajectory to use.
142   * @return A new {@link AutoTrajectory}.
143   */
144  public AutoTrajectory trajectory(String trajectoryName) {
145    return factory.trajectory(trajectoryName, this);
146  }
147
148  /**
149   * Creates a new {@link AutoTrajectory} to be used in an auto routine.
150   *
151   * @param trajectoryName The name of the trajectory to use.
152   * @param splitIndex The index of the split trajectory to use.
153   * @return A new {@link AutoTrajectory}.
154   */
155  public AutoTrajectory trajectory(String trajectoryName, final int splitIndex) {
156    return factory.trajectory(trajectoryName, splitIndex, this);
157  }
158
159  /**
160   * Creates a new {@link AutoTrajectory} to be used in an auto routine.
161   *
162   * @param <SampleType> The type of the trajectory samples.
163   * @param trajectory The trajectory to use.
164   * @return A new {@link AutoTrajectory}.
165   */
166  public <SampleType extends TrajectorySample<SampleType>> AutoTrajectory trajectory(
167      Trajectory<SampleType> trajectory) {
168    return factory.trajectory(trajectory, this);
169  }
170
171  /**
172   * Creates a trigger that produces a rising edge when any of the trajectories are finished.
173   *
174   * @param trajectory The first trajectory to watch.
175   * @param trajectories The other trajectories to watch
176   * @return a trigger that determines if any of the trajectories are finished
177   * @see #anyDone(int, AutoTrajectory, AutoTrajectory...) A version of this method that takes a
178   *     delay in cycles before the trigger is true.
179   */
180  public Trigger anyDone(AutoTrajectory trajectory, AutoTrajectory... trajectories) {
181    return anyDone(0, trajectory, trajectories);
182  }
183
184  /**
185   * Creates a trigger that produces a rising edge when any of the trajectories are finished.
186   *
187   * @param cyclesToDelay The number of cycles to delay.
188   * @param trajectory The first trajectory to watch.
189   * @param trajectories The other trajectories to watch
190   * @return a trigger that determines if any of the trajectories are finished
191   */
192  public Trigger anyDone(
193      int cyclesToDelay, AutoTrajectory trajectory, AutoTrajectory... trajectories) {
194    var trigger = trajectory.done(cyclesToDelay);
195    for (int i = 0; i < trajectories.length; i++) {
196      trigger = trigger.or(trajectories[i].done(cyclesToDelay));
197    }
198    return trigger.and(this.active());
199  }
200
201  /**
202   * Creates a trigger that returns true when any of the trajectories given are active.
203   *
204   * @param trajectory The first trajectory to watch.
205   * @param trajectories The other trajectories to watch
206   * @return a trigger that determines if any of the trajectories are active
207   */
208  public Trigger anyActive(AutoTrajectory trajectory, AutoTrajectory... trajectories) {
209    var trigger = trajectory.active();
210    for (int i = 0; i < trajectories.length; i++) {
211      trigger = trigger.or(trajectories[i].active());
212    }
213    return trigger.and(this.active());
214  }
215
216  /**
217   * Creates a command that will poll this event loop and reset it when it is cancelled.
218   *
219   * <p>The command will end instantly and kill the routine if the alliance supplier returns an
220   * empty optional when the command is scheduled.
221   *
222   * @return A command that will poll this event loop and reset it when it is cancelled.
223   * @see #cmd(BooleanSupplier) A version of this method that takes a condition to finish the loop.
224   */
225  public Command cmd() {
226    return cmd(() -> false);
227  }
228
229  /**
230   * Creates a command that will poll this event loop and reset it when it is finished or canceled.
231   *
232   * <p>The command will end instantly and kill the routine if the alliance supplier returns an
233   * empty optional when the command is scheduled.
234   *
235   * @param finishCondition A condition that will finish the loop when it is true.
236   * @return A command that will poll this event loop and reset it when it is finished or canceled.
237   * @see #cmd() A version of this method that doesn't take a condition and never finishes except if
238   *     the alliance supplier returns an empty optional when scheduled.
239   */
240  public Command cmd(BooleanSupplier finishCondition) {
241    return Commands.either(
242        Commands.run(this::poll)
243            .finallyDo(this::reset)
244            .until(() -> !DriverStation.isAutonomousEnabled() || finishCondition.getAsBoolean())
245            .withName(name),
246        Commands.runOnce(
247            () -> {
248              ChoreoAlert.alert("Alliance not known when starting routine", kWarning).set(true);
249              kill();
250            }),
251        allianceCtx::allianceKnownOrIgnored);
252  }
253}
